constructionism noun [U]
(SOCIAL THEORY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
social science
  specialized the idea that beliefs are formed by the habits and traditions of a society: Social constructionism views literary texts as representing social conventions. Philosophers of constructionism argue that science is an illusion.
More examplesFewer examplesSocial constructionism looks at how social phenomena develop in particular social contexts.

constructionism noun [U]
(EDUCATIONAL THEORY)
education
  specialized the idea that children learn best by doing things rather than by being told things: The whole basis of constructionism is to get children to make things. He was a major thinker in the theory of learning known as constructionism.
More examplesFewer examplesConstructionism is a variety of the theory of constructivism.
